title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 17.1 - Number plates continued
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 17.1 - Number plates continued

State Regulations
(a) Except as otherwise provided herein, number plates assigned to vehicles for the registration period commencing

January 1, 1966, and number plates assigned to vehicles on original
registrations in registration periods thereafter, shall consist of two plates
and one validating sticker except that only one number plate and one validating
sticker shall be assigned for trailer and motorcycle registrations. Such number
plates, or plate, shall be continued for succeeding registration periods, until
otherwise prescribed by the commissioner, so long as the vehicle is registered
in the name of the same person to whom such number plates were issued and the
vehicle is eligible for assignment of such plates. (b) Number plates issued for registration
periods commencing prior to January 1, 1973 and validation stickers for such
registrations shall be valid only until the end of the registration period for
which they are issued. Number plates issued for registration periods commencing

January 1, 1973 shall be reflectorized and shall be continued for succeeding
registration periods until otherwise prescribed by the commissioner, so long as
the vehicle is registered in the name of the same person to whom such number
plates were issued and the vehicle is eligible for assignment of such
plates. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
17.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
